SENT.plain: Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) is able to immortalize human B-lymphocytes with high efficiency
This property underlies the role of EBV in a number of human diseases
First, EBV is the causative agent of infectious mononucleosis, which is a benign proliferation of B-lymphocytes (1)
Second, EBV is involved in the etiology of Burkitt's lymphoma (2) and of invasive B-lymphocyte proliferations found in immunosuppressed individuals (3)
